rationales.hedonism: He explicitly prioritizes lived daily pleasure like cafe mornings over deferred retirement utility.
rationales.security: He knowingly rejects savings and future financial buffering despite aging-work uncertainty.

rationales.hedonism: After earning extra, he spends on a long, high-quality dinner with friends and values the evening's enjoyment over saving.

rationales.achievement: He feels most validated when his domain expertise is recognized and treated as valuable knowledge by others.

rationales.hedonism: He chooses bodily comfort and rest by skipping surge driving when his back hurts.
rationales.security: That comfort choice immediately reduces near-term earnings in a financially tight context.

rationales.hedonism: He spends work time at a cafe observing the street and frames that low-pressure pleasure as sufficient for the day.
He continues to choose small pleasures and flexible-hours narratives even while confronting aging-work anxiety.
rationales.security: He explicitly evaluates the risk that current gig comfort may not sustain future stability.

rationales.self_direction: He reasserts that gig work was an intentional life choice, not passive drift.
rationales.hedonism: He contrasts office misery with the sensory enjoyment of city views and flexible days, treating quality of life as the goal.

rationales.self_direction: He draws a firm boundary against returning to office work and evaluates alternatives that keep personal coherence.
rationales.security: He does explicit rent-risk math and acknowledges the need for tighter financial adaptation.

rationales.self_direction: He reframes options on his own terms, willing to move or work more while protecting core identity choices.
rationales.hedonism: He explicitly names small daily pleasures as the non-negotiable thread of a good life.
rationales.security: He takes practical steps toward affordability by exploring a cheaper flat and higher shift volume.
